sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -File "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\script.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -exec bypass -Noninteractive -windowstyle hidden -e  [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious FromBase64String Usage On Gzip Archive - Ps Script
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects attempts of decoding a base64 Gzip archive in a PowerShell script. This technique is often used as a method to load malicious content into memory afterward.

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=IEX(New-Object IO.StreamReader((New-Object System.IO.Compression.GzipStream([IO.MemoryStream][Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=bb5b6685-b30e-4309-8813-9194c79fbf54; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=IEX(New-Object IO.StreamReader((New-Object System.IO.Compression.GzipStream([IO.MemoryStream][Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=06e6c441-c566-47c9-a252-9a7d253e3707; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=powershell -exec bypass -Noninteractive -windowstyle hidden -e  [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=ef361e00-44c2-4eff-9fcd-20c1291f73a8; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\script.ps1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=powershell -exec bypass -Noninteractive -windowstyle hidden -e  [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=2eb8611a-0a6f-45e3-a7d2-4f41946f1c93; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\script.ps1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of PowerShell to identify the current logged user.

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (5579u), with no line terminators

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects PowerShell invocation with suspicious parameters
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
